Shreesh Srivastava

Salt Lake City, UT · Contact: 801-584-9504 · shreeshsriv@outlook.com

I’m a 4th-year Computer Science student at the University of Utah who enjoys building real-world, user-focused software. I work across the stack on web apps, data-driven tools, and real-time systems, especially anything that helps people plan better, learn faster, or improve a little every day.

This website is a home for my projects, experience, and the things I’m currently learning in software, systems, and product-building.

Projects

A few of the things I’ve been building recently. Most of these started as course projects or side projects and grew into experiments in UX, performance, and real-world usefulness.

SLC Trips

A trip-planning site focused on Salt Lake City that helps visitors quickly discover routes, hikes, neighborhoods, and places to explore. I’ve been using it as a sandbox to learn about performance, SEO, and building a clear, simple UX for travel planning.

TypeScript React Node.js Travel
GitHub Live Site
Dishbook

A recipe web app where users can save, search, and organize dishes in a clean, distraction-free interface. Built as a full-stack project to practice RESTful design, authentication, and templating.

Python Django PostgreSQL
GitHub Live Demo
Real-Time Multiplayer Snake

A real-time multiplayer Snake game using an authoritative C# server and a Blazor client. The project uses a custom TCP protocol, JSON messages, and a canvas-based frontend to explore networking, concurrency, and game-loop design.

C# Blazor TCP Canvas
GitHub Write-up

Experience

Full Stack Developer

Wasatch Wise LLC (Startup)

Developed full-stack applications and features for a startup, working across the technology stack to build user-facing software.

Aug 2025 – Dec 2025

Lab Assistant

VAAST Lab (Vision, Audition, Action in Space and Time)

Assisted in facilitating and innovating lab experiments by supporting setup, execution and data recording processes. Research focused on how visual perception of depth changes when changing the IPD (inter-pupillary distance) of VR headsets.

Aug 2025 – Present

Hospitality Manager

Lassonde Studios

Oversaw event logistics and coordinated hospitality services to ensure smooth operations. Managed schedules, communicated with vendors, and addressed customer concerns to maintain a high-quality experience. Improved customer satisfaction by streamlining feedback mechanisms and resolving issues promptly.

Aug 2024 – Present

Volunteer

U-Fit Program, University of Utah

Volunteered weekly to encourage kids and youth with disabilities by engaging with them in sports and activities.

Jan 2025 – Mar 2025

Exam Proctor & Testing Assistant

University of Utah Testing Center

Proctored exams, maintained a calm and fair testing environment, and helped coordinate overflow testing logistics. Developed attention to detail, responsibility, and communication in a setting with strict policies and high stakes for students.

2024 – Present

Parking Coordinator

Commuter Services, University of Utah

Managed high-volume parking operations during major university events, directing traffic to ensure smooth flow and guest support under strict time constraints. Worked long, high-pressure shifts with consistent punctuality and professionalism in fast-paced, crowded environments.

May 2024 – Aug 2024

Farmer's Market Assistant

University of Utah

Helped organize annual Farmer's Market at the University of Utah. Collaborated with vendors and invited them to organize the logistics of the farmer's market. Managed office tasks, including creating and maintaining spreadsheets in Excel for market evaluations. Helped advertise market, improved its website and promoted it on Instagram.

Aug 2023 – Dec 2023

Interests

Outside of classes and projects, I care a lot about fitness, personal growth, and building systems that help me stay consistent. You'll often find me in the gym, walking on an incline treadmill, or experimenting with routines and habits.

I also enjoy exploring new places in and around Salt Lake City, taking photos, and thinking about future projects and startups I'd like to build. A lot of my ideas for software come from these everyday experiences — how people travel, learn, and try to improve their lives a little bit at a time.
